required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Reliability and Validity of Strength Measurement of the Lower Limbs in Typically Developing Children
clinical_study.official_title: Reliability and Validity of Strength Measurement of the Lower Limbs in Typically Developing Children

brief_summary.textblock: Reliability of isokinetic strength measurement of the knee in typically developing children has yet been studied and seems to be good. Because in daily life activities strength of the hip- and ankle-joint muscles are also important, the investigators aim to study the reliability and validity of isokinetic strength measurements of the hip and ankle.

detailed_description.textblock:
Intra-tester reliability of isokinetic strength measurements of the knee, hip and ankle in a Biodex System 4 device will be studied. Children will be assessed at different movement velocities using the test-positions as proposed by the manufacturer. Maximum peak torque will be established.
Children will also perform functional strength assessments and the relation with the results of isokinetic strength measurements will be analysed.

primary_outcome.measure: Isokinetic strength assessment with Biodex System 4 device
primary_outcome.description: Isokinetic strength measurements of the lower limb (Max and Mean Newton Meter of 3 consecutive movements)

secondary_outcome.description: 30 second tests (number of trials in 30 seconds)

intervention.description: Reliability and validity of isokinetic strength measurement of the knee, hip and ankle in typically developing children.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- healthy children with good intellectual capacities
Exclusion Criteria:
- children with chronic disease or intellectual deficiency
